blog.name: animeandmanga-reactions
blog.title: Anime & Manga **Reactions**
blog.description: A blog space filled with honest reactions, fair reviews, and exciting recommendations. Feel free to send me an ask concerning one of your favorite animes or graphic novels. I'm always looking for new things to read, watch, share, and review!

body: Me, when Dany’s arrogant, smug, entitled ass made herself a little too comfortable sitting at the Lord and Lady’s table:

blog.name: wintersqueen
blog.title: Queen in the North
blog.description:
Sam | 28 | Female 
Sansa is the queen in the North
I talk more on twitter
netflix spoiler tags for 2 weeks

summary: Sansa’s greatest concern coming into 8x01 - besides the fact that it seems that Jon is thinking with his dick, instead of his...
body:
Sansa’s greatest concern coming into 8x01 - besides the fact that it seems that Jon is thinking with his dick, instead of his head - is food. And that’s exactly where her priorities need to be at the moment.

There’s an old saying, typically attributed to Napoleon, “[an] army marches on its stomach.”  It’s not just referring to a soldier’s hunger, but also the need to feed horses and livestock traveling with the army; a starving horse will not live long enough to see the start of a battle, much less the end of a war.

Beyond that, a hungry soldier is liable to revolt and refuse to continue forward. We saw this with the civilian population of Kings Landing when The Reach stopped providing food and goods. They revolved due to hunger and starvation, and would have killed any high-born they could get their hands on. Now imagine a force of soldiers doing the same.

An army cannot function without food.

Speaking of Napoleon earlier, lack of supplies and hypothermia are two attributes commonly associated to his loss against Russia. His army was said to be the greatest army ever assembled - sound familiar? - with 680,000 troops. When he left Russia 6 months later, he had only 27,000 left.

“May I ask, how are we meant to feed the greatest army the world has ever seen?”

It’s a valid question. And right now, it’s the most important question. I don’t see anyone offering a solution.

If Dany had come in with, “we have supplies from the Reach. This will help to feed not only my soldiers, but every person in the North assisting us in this battle” it would have gone a long way in bringing people over to her side. But instead, she burned it all. And that will have consequences.

body:
I’ll be clear

SANSA STARK ISN’T STRAIGHT AT ALL AND THERE’S LITERALLY NO REASON FOR HER TO STILL BE ATTRACTED TO MEN AFTER JOFFREY, RAMSAY AND LITTLEFINGER

tags: a song of fire and ice
A Song of Ice and Fire
title: Spoilers for Game of Thrones 8x01
body:
I keep reading how Dany is an entitled bitch for wanting Sansa to respect her authority, when in reality, Sansa is in the wrong here.

People will point out how Sansa (and the North) has right to be wary of Dany, which is true, BUT Sansa is going about it all of the wrong ways. What makes this issue even worse is how the series, via Arya, goes on about Sansa being the smartest woman she’s knows, and fans talking about how well Sansa plays the game.

Lets unpack this, Sansa had a handful of moments where she was smart, but her surviving as long as she did was due to others; whether it be because of promises they made to others, their natural inclinations to protect young girls, or because of their deprived feelings. This isn’t to say that Sansa is an idiot and lacks any smarts, but even that LF situation is questionable. We’ve seen nothing that shows that Sansa is the smartest woman in the series (or person) or that she has the acumen to play the game on the level of a high player. If Sansa operated like Margaery, I’d believe those claims, but she doesn’t. 

And how she is dealing with Dany, proves this even more. 

What purpose does it serve to be openly antagonistic to Dany? What purpose does it serve to actively undermine someone as a war against the undead looms. Fans say that Dany could be mad and Sansa knows how fucked up the royals are, which makes her antagonism even more groan worthy. 

Dany has fucking dragons. 

Why would you antagonize someone with dragons because you distrust them?

Instead of questioning Dany in front of other Lords, she should’ve done like Dany did and talk privately with her–as Dany did with Jon.

People also cite Sansa’s past abuse, but let’s keep in mind that Sansa wouldn’t tolerate disrespect from someone beneath her either–she’d also be demanding respect as well. No matter how distrustful you are, that doesn’t mean question them in public and behave standoff-ish. I mean, it’d make sense for her not to do this if she was the smart and politically savvy person she’s said to be, right??? 

She wouldn’t pull this shit with Cersei and only is doing it because she knows Dany and Jon has something going on. And I don’t believe she believes Dany is this mad woman either.

Let’s circle back to the abuse. I notice that people keep framing Dany and Sansa in an oppressor/oppressed light as if Sansa has only known nothing, but struggle and her entire life and as if she is the only one.

Before people get upset, hear me out: Sansa grew up with privilege, which was yanked away from her. She was then held as prison, forced to marry, and eventually raped and tortured, in addition to seeing her father get beheaded. That’s fucked up. But, let’s not forget Dany’s origin story: she was a poor orphan raised on the streets and abused by her brother. Married away without her consent, raped, lost her husband and child, and was rendered barren.

I’m not comparing to show who has it worse, but rather, to show that they both been through some fucked up shit. Just because Dany is in a position of extreme power now doesn’t mean she hasn’t had her own trials and tribulations to get where she is now. Nothing was handed to her. She fought for everything she has.

My problem isn’t that Sansa distrusts Dany, it’s that Sansa isn’t being the cunning or savvy person the series and fans claims she is. 

Jon wasn’t an idiot for bending knee to Dany. Outside of Dany, he is one of the few people who truly understand what they are battling. Jon is trying to save humanity not battle over a title and power that comes with it.

Jon also doesn’t have to consult with Sansa either just like Sansa wouldn’t have to consult with Jon if the shoe was on the other foot. I think Sansa is driven by wanting the greater good for the North, but she’s also more so driven by having power to protect herself. That’s reasonable, but she is playing her hand all wrong.

There are people who say that Dany should’ve handled her entrance into Winterfell differently and…maybe. But, also, she doesn’t have time to have the North warm up to her. Sansa was better off playing nice, regardless of if she actually liked Dany or not, and scheming in the background for what comes after the battle. Being openly antagonistic to an ally as a major threat looms only causes division and doesn’t nothing to help the effort.

She was better off asking that food question in private because what does she gain from asking it in front of the lords? Minus making herself look better to them.

Sans is all tell and no show in the series.

I think we’re also forgetting that, regardless of how Sansa feels, Dany is queen now. People have been killed over less and, as poor as it may seen, Dany is trying to work with her. All she is asking to be respected, not that Sansa likes her. That would make the transition of power “easier.”

Also, regardless of if the North is independent or not, the North has mostly always operated independent of the crown because royals rarely come up there. Hopefully this is all a diversion.

title: THEORY
body: The ‘super important scroll’ Sophie Turner kept as keepsake from the last episode is actually Jon’s will naming her heir and Queen of the Seven Kingdoms. She gets it after he and Dany die somehow or another.

reblog.comment: The ‘super important scroll’ Sophie Turner kept as keepsake from the last episode is actually Jon’s will naming her heir and Queen of the Seven Kingdoms. She gets it after he and Dany die somehow or another.

trail.content: The ‘super important scroll’ Sophie Turner kept as keepsake from the last episode is actually Jon’s will naming her heir and Queen of the Seven Kingdoms. She gets it after he and Dany die somehow or another.

Like as much as I like (even...
body:
Sansa might single-handedly save the whole world. Wow. I stan. I’ve chosen to follow the right one.

Like as much as I like (even love) the others, Sansa is THAT bitch that rule it all. Come hell or high water. Sansa Stark is IT™. Thanks.

summary: Game of thrones spends way too much time on such phrases as ' [he/she] is the smartest/strongest/coldest/most beautiful'. You...
body: Game of thrones spends way too much time on such phrases as ’ [he/she] is the smartest/strongest/coldest/most beautiful’. You have less than 10 hours before the end. DO the fucking STORY. Show, not tell. It’s like the basic rule of storytelling. I would somehow get that he/she is so smart if you let me see him/her do smth. CHRIST.
